meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel extremely embarrassed or ashamed.
meanings.sent1: She mortified her friend by revealing a secret in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: He was mortified when he realized he had been wearing his shirt inside out all day.
meanings.sent3: The cat mortified the dog by stealing its favorite toy and parading around with it.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected prank left him feeling mortified, like a spotlight had been shone on his deepest insecurities.
meanings.sent5: The public speaking mishap was so mortifying that he avoided social events for weeks.

meanings.sent1: She had a mortified expression on her face after tripping in front of her crush.
meanings.sent2: He felt mortified when he realized he had mispronounced his own name during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The mortified look on his face when he accidentally wore mismatched socks was priceless.
meanings.sent4: Her mortified silence spoke volumes about how deeply the teasing had affected her.
meanings.sent5: The mortified student wished the ground would open up and swallow her whole after her phone loudly rang in class.
